sen.j: 芝 祐靖（しば すけやす、1935年8月13日 -）は、雅楽家、日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: Sukeyasu SHIBA (August 13, 1935 -) is a gagakuka, or a person who plays old Japanese court music, and is also a member of the Japan Art Academy.
Sukeyasu SHIBA (August 13, 1935 -) is a gagakuka, or a musician who plays old Japanese court music, and a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現に変えました。
sen.e: Sukeyasu SHIBA (August 13, 1935 -) is a gagakuka, or a musician who plays old Japanese court music, and a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 東京出身。
sen.e: He is from Tokyo Prefecture.
He is from Tokyo Prefecture.
He is from Tokyo Prefecture.

sen.j: 芸術院会員芝祐泰の子。
sen.e: He is a son of Sukehiro SHIBA, who was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He is a son of Sukehiro SHIBA, who was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He is a son of Sukehiro SHIBA, who was a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 狛氏の一族で代々続く雅楽楽師の家柄。
sen.e: He is from a gagaku gakushi (musician) family, within the Koma clan, that has been continuing for generations.
He is from a gagaku gakushi (musician) family, within the Koma clan, that has been continuing for generations.
He is from a gagaku gakushi (musician) family, within the Koma clan, that has been continuing for generations.

sen.j: 1951年薗広進、上近正、薗広茂に師事。
sen.e: In 1951, he started to study under Koshin SONO, Chikamasa UE, and Hiroshige SONO.
In 1951, he started to study under Koshin SONO, Chikamasa UE, and Hiroshige SONO.
In 1951, he started to study under Koshin SONO, Chikamasa UE, and Hiroshige SONO.

sen.j: 1955年宮内庁楽部楽生科卒。
sen.e: In 1955, he graduated from the Kunaicho gakubu (Music Department of the Imperial Household Agency) school.
In 1955, he graduated from the Kunaicho gakubu (Music Department of the Imperial Household Agency) school.
In 1955, he graduated from the Kunaicho gakubu (Music Department of the Imperial Household Agency) school.

sen.j: 1958年宮内庁楽部楽師。
sen.e: In 1958, he became a master musician of the Kunaicho gakubu in 1949.
In 1958, he became a master musician of the Kunaicho gakubu in 1949.
In 1958, he became a master musician of the Kunaicho gakubu in 1949.

sen.j: 1964年芸術祭奨励賞、1971年芸術祭賞優秀賞受賞。
sen.e: In 1964, he received the Art Encouragement Prize, and in 1971, he received the Arts Festival Excellence Award.
In 1964, he received the Art Encouragement Prize, and in 1971, he received the Arts Festival Excellence Award.
In 1964, he received the Art Encouragement Prize, and in 1971, he received the Arts Festival Excellence Award.

sen.j: 1978年東京芸術大学非常勤講師。
sen.e: In 1978, he became a part-time assistant professor at Tokyo University of the Arts.
In 1978, he became a part-time assistant professor at Tokyo University of the Arts.
In 1978, he became a part-time assistant professor at Tokyo University of the Arts.

sen.j: 1984年宮内庁楽部退職。
sen.e: In 1984, he left the Kunaicho gakubu.
In 1984, he left the Kunaicho gakubu.
In 1984, he left the Kunaicho gakubu.

sen.j: 1985年雅楽団体「怜楽舎」音楽監督。
sen.e: In 1985, he became a music director of a gagaku performance group called 'Reigakusha.'
In 1985, he became a music director of a gagaku performance group called 'Reigakusha.'
In 1985, he became a music director of a gagaku performance group called 'Reigakusha.'

sen.j: 1988年国立音楽大学客員教授（－2001年）。
sen.e: From 1988 (to 2001), he taught as a guest professor at the Kunitachi College of Music.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From 1988 (to 2001), he taught as a guest professor at the Kunitachi College of Music.
From 1988 (to 2001), he taught as a guest professor at the Kunitachi College of Music.

sen.j: 同年、芸術選奨文部大臣賞受賞。
sen.e: Also in 1988, he received the Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also in 1988, he received the Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts.
Also in 1988, he received the Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts.

sen.j: 1989年フィンランド・クフモ音楽祭、イタリア・ペルージア音楽祭などで雅楽を紹介演奏。
sen.e: In 1989, he performed gagaku to introduce it at the Kuhmo Festival in Finland and also at Music Fest Ferugia in Italy.
In 1989, he performed gagaku to introduce it at the Kuhmo Festival in Finland and also at the Music Fest Perugia in Italy.
In 1989, he performed gagaku to introduce it at the Kuhmo Festival in Finland and also at the Music Fest Perugia in Italy.

sen.j: 1997年モ－ビル音楽賞受賞。
sen.e: In 1997, he received the Exxon Mobil Award.
In 1997, he received the Exxon Mobil Award.
In 1997, he received the Exxon Mobil Award.

sen.j: 1998年冬季長野オリンピック開会式で「君が代」演奏。
sen.e: 1998, he played Kimigayo (Japan's national anthem) at the opening ceremony of the XVIII Olympic Winter Games held in Nagano City.
1998, he played Kimigayo (Japan's national anthem) at the opening ceremony of the XVIII Olympic Winter Games held in Nagano City.
1998, he played Kimigayo (Japan's national anthem) at the opening ceremony of the XVIII Olympic Winter Games held in Nagano City.

sen.j: 1999年伝統文化ポーラ賞受賞、紫綬褒章受章。
sen.e: In 1999, he received the Pola Award for Traditional Culture and also the Shiju-hosho (Medal of Honor with the Purple Ribbon).
In 1999, he received the Pola Award for Traditional Culture and also the Shiju-hosho (Medal of Honor with the Purple Ribbon).
In 1999, he received the Pola Award for Traditional Culture and also the Shiju-hosho (Medal of Honor with the Purple Ribbon).

sen.j: 2000年東京芸大退職。
sen.e: In 2000, he left Tokyo University of the Arts.
In 2000, he retired from Tokyo University of the Arts.
sen.cmt: より正確な表現に変えました。
sen.e: In 2000, he retired from Tokyo University of the Arts.

sen.j: 2002年中島健蔵音楽賞特別賞受賞。
sen.e: In 2002, he received the Kenzo Nakajima Special Music Award.
In 2002, he received the Kenzo Nakajima Special Music Award.
In 2002, he received the Kenzo Nakajima Special Music Award.

sen.j: 2003年日本芸術院賞・恩賜賞受賞、日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: In 2003, he received the Onshi Prize and also the Award of the Japan Art Academy, and became a member of the academy.
